author: adamrusch
title: The Immutable Research Institute
description: 区块链社区需要更多的组织，能够支持教育和倡导有利的立法的努力

f6_assessments.q0: 根据我的理解，这个提案的目的是建立一个非营利组织，作为专门的专家处理有关加密货币、区块链技术和Cardano的问题，但重点是州级政策的立法/监管方面。问题陈述的方式既容易理解，又与挑战相联系，问题的解决方案也很明确。基本上，该提案的目的是在存在大量错误信息的地方传播信息，尽管很多决定都是影响整个生态系统的。这是一个需要时间来发展其全部潜力的项目，但从长远来看，可能会被证明是非常有价值的。(这个团队似乎对这一点有所了解）。通过大学和游说来增加与该组织的合作者，将在未来覆盖两个非常重要的环境。那些参与决策的人，以及那些在未来的人。如果该项目能够发展到其预期的潜力，那么对于整个社区和生态系统来说，无论是在微观还是宏观层面，都是非常值得的投资。我非常同意这个提案有效地解决了这个挑战。
f6_assessments.q1:
核心团队的专业知识具有广泛的技能。教育（大学水平），在金融部门工作的经验，以及电子工程。有了这套能力，就能很好地说明对进一步发展和维持这个项目所需要的东西有一个广泛的理解。如果提案中能有一些链接来进一步加强每个团队成员的能力证明，例如LinkedIn的简介，那将是非常有益的。虽然，这可以通过几分钟的谷歌搜索来找到。有很多专业知识，但最好能有进一步的证明，以使这些技能更容易被验证。该团队的目标是继续发展该组织，即使他们不会得到资助，这说明了相关人员的良好承诺。发展的计划在路线图中提供，并且一步一步地进行了详尽的解释。大部分的预算拨款将用于支付法律费用，由于在美国创建一个非营利组织的复杂性，并考虑到路线图的长达一年的时间框架，这是有道理的。让这个提案更加清晰的是，加入一个更大的时间框架，第一年之后会发生什么？该提案说明了它打算在那个时候达到的目标，但在更长期内有哪些可能的里程碑？评论部分为我们提供了一点信息，提案人打算将他们的联系扩大到许多大学，但保持在全国范围内。另外，为了理解预算分配，最好能提供预算细目中的进一步细节。要把多少工作时间分给多少聘用人员，等等。
总而言之，我同意这个建议将被成功实施。
f6_assessments.q2: 建议书中提供的路线图是清晰和容易理解的，有3、6和12个月的里程碑。路线图中最好包括一些成功的衡量标准，或关键绩效指标。该团队的目标是与多少所大学合作，在什么时间框架内？该提案描述了计划在某个时间与一些区块链倡导者接触，但他们是谁，有多少人？他们的基地在哪里？为了衡量组织的成长和发展，包括一些社区链接会对提案有好处。我们在哪里可以跟踪发展，或与该组织取得联系？即使这样的平台还没有启动，为了增加透明度，最好能看到团队在计划如何让社区关注其进展。另外，在文本中加入一些关于理解与项目有关的潜在风险或挑战的想法，将对提案大有裨益。如果我作为一个社区成员看到团队了解可能出现的障碍，并愿意与我这个社区成员分享该计划，这将增加社区和组织之间的信任、透明度和沟通。说到这里，我同意这个提案为我提供了足够的信息来评估实现其既定目标的进展。

f6_assessments.q0: 对于任何观看了美国国会区块链听证会的人来说，非常明显的是，法律和政策制定者对什么是区块链技术存在着广泛的知识真空。这种无知只能导致错误的信息和监管，可能会损害而不是促进技术发展。虽然这个建立Immutable Rsch研究所的建议将更多地以国家为中心，但它是那种仍然可以为任何人（甚至联邦调查局）提供信息的组织，可以从中学习。我目前是奥地利一个州级主要政党的成员，以前曾协助为当地议员准备反对派研究，以便为其投票提供信息，我可以证明，如果你想为你的选民提供最好的信息，所有的信息都要考虑（地方、州、联邦）。这个提案的目的是建立这样一个组织，可以帮助向当权者提供信息，提案人的素质和他们着眼于长期的未来以支持我们的生态系统的方式是值得赞扬的。我同意这项建议属于这项挑战的目标，并祝你们好运。
f6_assessments.q1: 提议者建立IRI的理由是合乎逻辑的，而且所阐述的建立一个有资格的组织的步骤与这些机构是一致的。提案人在高等教育、金融和金融技术方面的资格也使他们成为合适的、有学识的加密货币行业的大使。12个月内按季度划分的计划是你所期望的，我建议这个提案的改进之处在于知道IRI是否将或将要求与伊利诺伊大学正式联系，这将是理想的。建立研究所所需的资金是非常合理的，而且提案人承认，无论催化剂资金是否到位，他们的计划都会继续进行，这充分说明了他们想要成功的意图。我同意这个报告有足够的能力获得成功，并祝愿这个团队顺利。
f6_assessments.q2: 由于隐私问题，3个月和6个月阶段的活动极不可能被公开分享，这一点非常容易理解，尤其是美国国税局的参与。作为审计的一部分，可以分享的是这种申请的结果和它最终作为一个非营利组织的建立。就12个月的目标而言，它应该使他们对更广泛的加密货币讨论的贡献更加明显和公开。提议者以前曾利用过Meetups，我感觉这也可能是他们进展的一个可审计点，如果需要的话。在审查所附视频时，我可以证明参与者的诚实意图和善意，这为这个项目的跟踪提供了极大的信心。作为一个曾经为政党工作过的人和一个选民，我祝愿你在建立这样一个机构时一切顺利，这只会推动我们的行业发展。

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is not aimed at creating a lobbying organisation to sway legislative policies. It is aimed at the creation of an informing entity for mainly academic campuses. In this particular proposal the project requests funding to cover for the legal aspects of setting up a non-profit organisation. The organisation itsself is a superb idea and given the competencies in the team and professionality that it holds, it could be one with great future impact. It is just not a great fit for this niche challenge and would fit better in a challenge to scale-up informational hubs.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposing team has ties to academic institutions and the banking sector and legal policy making. The latter should be clearer mentioned in the proposal as it only became apparent about 20 minutes in the video. The lectures that are already performed are quite professionally executed and could realise a demand by universities to explain this technology to their students. There is no funding breakdown to explain the requested 15K USD. Not that it seems to be too much, just that a detail in spending reinforces confidence in terms of feasibility. Adding this to the proposal would improve it.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a difference between KPIs and a roadmap. In this proposal, both have been combined in one format, creating difficulties to determine what is intended to do and what is considered a success after each quarterly period. As the project is dependent on lectures, it is also dependent on the institutions hiring the lecture. To ensure confidence in this, the proposal would be improved with a risk assessment ensuring constant hires so the lectures get heard.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal asks for funding the initial administration costs of opening up a non-profit organization in the US to advocate for favorable legislation in the US. The project wants to provide templates for filing non-profit organizations in the US after consulting with their lawyers. Long-term it is the plan to build a network of blockchain advocates.
f6_assessments.q1: There are legit people behind the project that can be found on LinkedIn (although not provided by them). They are 3 people that have backgrounds in policy education, banking and IT which seems suitable for their endavour. However, the roles and their current political relations are not clear. I think it is likely they will successfully build the non-profit, but  the success of the Research Institue remains unclear. Only future and more information about their networking etc. will tell. Regarding their budgeting: they request 15k dollars for the initial set up costs. It would be useful to break down the costs more (how much are lawyers etc. costing). This is currently not provided.
f6_assessments.q2: The poblem statement and solution don't become entirely clear. It is stated that more organizations are needed to advocate for crypto legislation. Although that might be true, no further explanations on the current situation and the amount of crypto advocating organizations are given. As a non-US citizen it doesn't become clear why the Immutable Research Institute would solve the "problem". The project team provides a basic roadmap that outlines their plan to set up the organization and file for non-profit. But a clear metrirc of success is not given. Especially the benefits for the Catalyst Community are not outlined enough (like the templates). Furthermore, risks like not gaining political momentum and failing to build a successful network of advocates are not addressed.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal brings a clear explanation of the problem vs. solution and brings aspects of their uniqueness (although more evidence of their quality control could be given for the community to assess it). It correctly addresses the challenge and the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal brings enough evidence ou the team's experience, but it lacks information about the budget plan (no detailing was given, no specific items were described). Therefore, the plan can be better explained so the community can better assess if they will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2:
At the same time that the proposal is clear on its goals and roadmap, it's not easily auditable because it does not bring much information of their concrete actions, outcomes or products. One could extract them from their roadmap, however, they are still too abstract to be auditable. Ex:
"we will be part of a robust network"
"we will be ready answer any questions"

Suggestion for improvement: bring concrete and auditable information for the community to follow if the project succeed in each step.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal of the organization in the proposal is clearly much broader than current challenge. However, it is clearly an important initiative and sufficiently addressing the specific challenge as well.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind the proposal in very interesting, bringing together academia, finance, and tech. Therefore the team clearly has the experience to implement this project successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The idea is very well outlined and categorized into the 3-month, 6-month, and 12-month timeline, which supports auditing the progress. However, the proposal itself is more towards supporting the (future) organization, not so much a specific (action) plan, therefore making it harder to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Awesome proposal and a great long-term initiative. I think the organization's mission is a solution to gaining influence in the public policy space for blockchain. This is fantastic and effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a detailed plan of activities. My concern is that the proposal does not define success. Also the strategy should have focus-driven programs that would enable the yet-to-set-up organization to achieve its mission. Excellence team experience.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be great to detail a breakdown of activities the requested fund would be used. Also, the proposal did not show how its activities would be documented. This is necessary for tracking and auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal outlines a great place to start with a research institute to provide the information needed by public servants and politicians. Links with all the other education institutions  investing resource in DLT research and building a network of networks would be a great next step to build mass and share big workload of lobbying.
f6_assessments.q1: Missing some key people, advocacy, policy, lobbying skills. Not for profit entity will most likely be stood-up. What's missing is what then... what are the first education initiatives? Who will they be targeting to participate? How inclusive and accessible will they be?
f6_assessments.q2: More information on what the research institute plans to do (tangible and intangible) needed to audit its contribution to the challenge. For example; "We will be a resource to anyone who wishes to learn more about favorable blockchain policies and put them into action." What is the resource? Have the team drafted or curated favourable policies as a reference? What work is available from the proposers around what the blockers, incentives, disincentives, etc. are to favourable legislation and ways to work them using all the lobbying tools and tricks (which usually means having something to trade!)

f6_assessments.q0: This projects approaches the challenge from an educational angle. Their purpose is to be an educational resource and advocate for favorable legislation. I think that starting by focusing on state legislation is a smart move, as federal policy often takes note from what has been done at the state level.
f6_assessments.q1: It's clear that this team brings a lot of experience in education and finance--which are two pivotal skillsets for this education/lobbying effort. The team also offers a project roadmap and clear set of goals.
f6_assessments.q2: While it would be nice to see a budget breakdown for the $15,000 in funding, I think that their outlined goals and goals will make it possible to audit their progress.

solution: 我们正在创办一个非营利性实体，将进行区块链教育，并倡导有利的立法。
experience: 创始成员包括一位教育政策博士、德意志银行的资产经理和一位高频交易公司的系统管理员。
